types.description: Search for relevant information (holotapes, notes, terminals, wildlife observations, etc.) and write a report for the *#report-room* if any of that information is not already in the scrolls.
types.icly: You are ordered to proceed to the target location. File a report if you learn anything that is not already recorded in the scrolls.

types.description: The intent of this patrol is to provide you with an opportunity to roleplay as watch standers while on duty.
types.icly: Your team has been ordered to proceed to the target location. Clear the vicinity of any hostiles and proceed to stand watch. Command has asked that you guard the entrance of this area for at least 20 minutes.

types.description:
Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the cargo carrier is attacked or hit by anything. The cargo is scattered over Appalachia and destroyed if the result is odd.

The cargo carrier cannot directly engage in combat with the enemy except to use melee weapons (or their rifle butt) to defend themselves while carrying cargo.
types.icly: Command has ordered that a supply cache be set up at the target location. Deposit excess aid items and ammo in a container after the location is secured.

types.description: Loiter for a reasonable amount of time, offer assistance, and report any interesting encounters. Be on your best behavior and represent!
types.icly: Command has ordered a relief package delivered to local survivors as a show of good faith. Gather your team and proceed to a nearby encampment. Interact with the locals and loiter for a reasonable amount of time, offering assistance to anyone who comes by.

types.description: File a simplified report detailing the totals found even if location has been explored in the past.
types.icly: Stores are running low, and you have received orders scavenge what you can. Proceed to target location and scavenge any ammo, food, or medical supplies you can find along the way.

types.description: Proceed to target location and clear the vicinity of all hostiles.
types.icly: We've identified a threat in Appalachia. Proceed to target location and eliminate all enemies of the Brotherhood. Ad Victoriam!

types.description:
Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the cargo carrier is attacked or hit by anything. The cargo is scattered over Appalachia and destroyed if the result is odd.

The cargo carrier cannot directly engage in combat with the enemy except to use melee weapons (or their rifle butt) to defend themselves while carrying cargo.
types.icly: Our scribes have worked diligently and have prepared another batch of recon scopes. Your team as been ordered to make your way to Fort Defiance with a the recon scope box, where you will sync them at the Artillery Battery Terminal.

types.description: Assign two cargo carriers, who must remain close to each other to approximate carrying the ammunition. The ordanance crate may me *set* down by one of the carrying members but doing so risks damaging its contents. When picking it back up roll 1d6; if a 5 or 6 is rolled then its contents are destroyed and the patrol is a failure.
types.icly: We have received reports that the ASAM turret and the artillery battery at Fort Defiance are in need of resupply to maintain operational readiness. Your team has been selected to resupply this vital ordnance.

types.description: Proceed to the Helipad at Atlas Observatory, and go an on actual patrol, making a wide circle around Atlas, all the way down to the train tracks and all the way around. Clear out any hostiles you run into, interact with any players you run into, must fly the roleplay team flag during the patrol. Patrol ends back on the Helipad.
types.icly: Your team has been assigned the watch. Proceed to Fort Atlas and patrol both the grounds and surrounding Vicinity. You are authorized to engage any hostiles encountered. If locals are encroaching politely warn them that this location is under the control of the Brotherhood of Steel.

types.description:
Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the cargo carrier is attacked or hit by anything. The cargo is scattered over Appalachia and destroyed if the result is odd.

The cargo carrier cannot directly engage in combat with the enemy except to use melee weapons (or their rifle butt) to defend themselves while carrying cargo.
types.icly: Our perishable supplies are overflowing. Command has ordered your team into action to bring our excess supplies to Foundation to show our appreciation for their diligence. These excess supplies have been stashed at the target location. Your team is to proceed to the pickup location and transport them to Foundation.

types.description:
**This patrol requires at least four people!** Both the missing patrol and search teams need to have at least two people, who are in separate teams. The HUD must be switched off.

Each member of the missing team must roll on the **casualty system table** to determine the severity of their wounds. They cannot use water, food, or stimpacks, can only have a single clip of ammo, and must survive in or near the location for the patrol duration.

The search team's objective is to reach the missing patrol. The leader of the search team must pick a safe location to take the missing team for Evac. The missing team cannot enter combat during the escort. The patrol fails if even a single person of the missing team is downed.
types.icly: A patrol team has gone missing. Your team has been ordered locate them and provide assistance. Your target is the last known radio contact location.

types.description: Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the DNA carrier is attacked or hit by anything. A sample is destroyed if the result is odd. If two or more samples are broken while en-route, then the patrol has failed.
types.icly: Another batch of Sierra Bravo DNA samples are ready to make their way to Vault-Tec University. The DNA has been stashed at the target location, which you will use as a staging ground. We need those samples to figure out how to finally bring an end the scorched.

types.description: Remain at the target location until three waves of scorched have been eliminated. The mission fails if a scorchbeast escapes containment.
types.icly: Your team is to proceed to the active fissure site closest to the target location and stand watch.

types.description: Characters must be armed with either a hunting rifle or bow. Hunt for ediable meat and gather edible vegetation in the area until at least 10 food items have been found. Make a survival check on the first instance of each individual animal or plant harvested during the patrol.
types.icly: Food supplies are running low. Command has ordered your team to form a hunting party and proceed to the target location.

types.description:
Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the cargo carrier is attacked or hit by anything. The cargo is scattered over Appalachia and destroyed if the result is odd.

The cargo carrier cannot directly engage in combat with the enemy except to use melee weapons (or their rifle butt) to defend themselves while carrying cargo.
types.icly: The settlers at Foundation have contacted us via radio to report an excess of medical supplies. They intend to share these supplies with us. Your team is to immediately proceed to Foundation. You are ordered to collect these supplies and deliver them to Fort Atlas.

types.description:
All involved members must have their HUD turned off!

The infiltration team is to proceed to the center of the target location and fire off a flare to announce they have secured the location. The team cannot use any weapons during their infiltration attempt. All infiltrators must have a flare gun in their possession.

The objective will be to stop the infiltrators by shooting them (with the modified AER-9) before they reach their goal.
types.icly: Your team has been flagged in our database as overdue for objective defense training. Split into into two teams. One team will be designated as the defense team, who is tasked with defending the target location from the attackers. Defenders will be issued specially modified AER-9 rifles with Beta Wave tuners for this mission for target designation purposes. Clear out any hostiles at the training location prior to proceeding with the exercise.

types.description:
Assign a cargo carrier. Roll 1d6 every time the cargo carrier is attacked or hit by anything. The cargo is scattered over Appalachia and destroyed if the result is odd.

The cargo carrier cannot directly engage in combat with the enemy except to use melee weapons (or their rifle butt) to defend themselves while carrying cargo.
types.icly: Orders for a clandestine recon attempt have been issued. The situation on the ground requires that our identity is not discovered by the locals. Gather your team and suit up in disguises fitting the target location. Mission objectives include gathering information from the locals and planting the supplied transmitter in an inconspicuous place. Do not get caught!

types.description: Assign two cargo carriers. The selected personnel must remain close to each other to approximate carrying the ammunition. The ordnance crate may be set down by one of the carrying members making a declaration to that effect, but doing so risks damaging it's contents. When picking it back up roll 1d6, if a 5-6 is rolled the contents are destroyed and the patrol is a failure.
types.icly: Our scouts have reported a large cache of ammo has been found at the target location. Your team has been tasked with collecting it. Proceed directly to target location, collect the cache, and return the ammunition to Fort Atlas.

locations.location: Big Papa Moe's Lip Smackin' Sandwich Shack
